snippet: On the eve of a meeting with Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, the United Arab Emirates announced that it had shut down an organization that promotes democracy.
abstract: United Arab Emirates, an ally of the United States, decides to shutter the offices of an American-financed group that promotes democracy on the eve of a meeting with Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton; no public explanation has been given for the action against the National Democratic Institute, which was one of several nonprofits prosecuted in Egypt amid concerns about what many Egyptians perceive as foreign meddling.

byline.contributor: Thom Shanker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: On the eve of a meeting with Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, the United Arab Emirates announced that it had shut down an organization that promotes democracy.

headline.seo: United Arab Emirates Shuts U.S.-Sponsored Group
headline.main: United Arab Emirates Shutters U.S.-Backed Group
headline.print_headline: United Arab Emirates Shuts Down U.S.-Financed Democracy Group
